name: Piratebox-manager
tagline: David Dard's Piratebox scripts reformed for laptop usage.
body:
##########################################################################
## PirateBox-Manager (By Cale Black)
##########################################################################
## Quick installer / manager for the Laptop PirateBox project
## For both advanced and basic users
## created by Cale Black (cablack@rams.colostate.edu)  2012-05-05
## Liscenced by GPL
## Changes: (0.8.8)
## Major bug fixes
More info and updates at: CyberNihilism.net
and			  forum.daviddarts.com

TODO:
	Finalize Menu [Done]
	Add a splash screen with ASCII PirateBox logo [Done]
	Add manage files (opens PB folder in nautilaus) [Done]
	Add Manual	
	Create a Config option [Done]
	Add Debugging
	Interface for managing files (may wait until GUI)

	LiveCD Fork [In Progress with First Version released]

	Lighttpd form using /MaStr/PirateBoxScripts_Webserver [In progress]

Here are some images of it running: http://imgur.com/a/MLWcv
##########################################################################
## PirateBox for Laptops Scripts (By Matthias Strubel)
##########################################################################
## Piratebox for debian laptops --> scripts
##   created by Matthias Strubel (matthias.strubel@aod-rpg.de)  2011-02-22
##   licenced by gpl ;; please feel for improvements or feedback :)
##  Changes:
##

Complete Download-Package and more Infos on: http://piratebox.aod-rpg.de

Branches:
    piratebox (this)	- Scripts Based on David Dart's file-compilation
                          init.d scripts for Debian based laptops 
   
   lighttpd  -  Beta-Scripts for running PirateBox with
                          lighttpd. (alpha perl-droopy-version)

   imageboard - Scripts for running Piratebox and Kareha Imagebaord


TODO:
   * Improve landing page (jquery, css ... )
   * Lighttpd: Exchange perl & python scripts with ash version (no fat interpreter on routers is much better)
  
REFERENCES:
  - The PirateBox project:
      http://wiki.daviddarts.com/PirateBox_DIY
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
